result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly Leigh Blackdeer

records.addlTxt:
11:05 AM Defendant Kimberly Blackdeer in court. Attorney Pollak (special appearance) appears by video. Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does not qualify for public defender. Court addresses the DEF on her non-appearance. State makes bond recommendation. Atty Pollak argues bond. Court addresses DEF, DEF responds. Court gives the DEF the attorney colloquy. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel. Court enters Not Guilty Plea. Court sets bond. Status Conference set. 


COURT: $1500 SIB with standard Conditions
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on August 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Uploaded and processed document to Sharefile, sent paper copy to dispatch, printed warrant card.

09:22 AM Defendant Kimberly Leigh Blackdeer not in court.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State requests warrant.   Court grants request.  Warrant authorized (Sawyer and Surrounding Counties) as requested.
